Title: Adversarial Threshold Neural Computer for Molecular de Novo Design
Notes: An in-house library was screened to identify high-Tanimoto-similarity molecules to the generated set. Therefore, none of the generated molecules were directly experimentally validated.

Title: Entangled Conditional Adversarial Autoencoder for de Novo Drug Discovery
Optimization Algorithm Class: Conditional generation (conditioned on binding affinity/activity against JAK3)

Title: Deep learning enables rapid identification of potent DDR1 kinase inhibitors
Outcome: nM inhibitor with in vivo validation
Notes: Generated, synthesized, and performed in vitro and in vivo validation within 46 days.

Title: Design and Synthesis of DDR1 Inhibitors with a Desired Pharmacophore Using Deep Generative Models
Notes: Pharmacophore matching approach.

Title: Generative and reinforcement learning approaches for the automated de novo design of bioactive compounds
Generative deep learning enables the discovery of a potent and selective RIPK1 inhibitor
Outcome: µM inhibitor with in vivo validation
Notes: The pre-trained model was fine-tuned via transfer learning and the generate set was virtually screened. This is an example of how generative design and virtual screening can be complementary.

Title: AlphaFold accelerates artificial intelligence powered drug discovery: efficient discovery of a novel CDK20 small molecule inhibitor
Notes: First experimental validated example that used an AlphaFold structure for structure-based design. 2 rounds of generation. There were also additional actives with a concrete measured potency > 10 µM.

Title: Discovery of Potent, Selective, and Orally Bioavailable Small-Molecule Inhibitors of CDK8 for the Treatment of Cancer
Outcome: nM inhibitor with in vivo validation
Notes: The molecule was further optimized by manual domain-expert SAR ultimately resulting in in vivo validation.

Title: De Novo Design of κ-Opioid Receptor Antagonists Using a Generative Deep-Learning Framework
Discovery of novel and selective SIK2 inhibitors by the application of AlphaFold structures and generative models
Design Task: De novo structure-based design (core scaffold was fixed)
Notes: Used an AlphaFold structure for structure-based design.

Title: Discovery of Novel and Potent Prolyl Hydroxylase Domain-Containing Protein (PHD) Inhibitors for The Treatment of Anemia
Outcome: nM inhibitor with in vivo validation
Notes: Further SAR studies were performed by domain-experts, ultimately leading to in vivo validation

Title: Local Scaffold Diversity-Contributed Generator for Discovering Potential NLRP3 Inhibitors
Design Task: De novo design with an activity model
Outcome: N/A - no generated molecules were *directly* synthesized and tested
Notes: 12 generated molecules were selected for docking and analysis of the binding poses short-listed two scaffolds. Derivatives were designed based on these two scaffolds, resulting in a nM inhibitor

Title: Discovery of new antiviral agents through artificial intelligence: In vitro and in vivo results
Target: Neuraminidase (NA) of influenza A and B viruses
Most Potent Design: EC50 0.4 μM against A/St. Petersburg/63/2020, 0.29 μM against A/Vladivostok/2/2009, and 0.74 μM against B/Samara/32/2018 strains
Notes: in vivo validation was demonstrated

Title: Target-aware Molecule Generation for Drug Design Using a Chemical Language Model
Notes: Commercially available analogues were tested and were µM potent (IC50). Only 1 generated molecule was directly synthesized

Title: Quantum Computing-Enhanced Algorithm Unveils Novel Inhibitors for KRAS
Notes: First example of a quantum computer application with experimental validation. There were also additional actives with a concrete measured potency > 10 µM

Title: Generate What You Can Make: Achieving in-house synthesizability with readily available resources in de novo drug design
Design Task: De novo design with an activity model
Notes: Generation using in-house collection of building blocks

Title: A small-molecule TNIK inhibitor targets fibrosis in preclinical and clinical models
Outcome: nM inhibitor with in vivo validation
Notes: Initial generation led to a nM potent compound but with poor ADMET properties resulting in high clearance in human and mice liver microsomes. Lead optimization led to improved ADMET properties and ultimately in vivo validation. Phase 1 clinical trial results were reported and this molecule is the first generative design to progress to phase 2 clinical trials

Title: Accelerating factor Xa inhibitor discovery with a de novo drug design pipeline
Notes: 8 commercially available generated molecules were purchased. Only the most potent affinity was reported

Title: PocketFlow is a data-and-knowledge-driven structure-based molecular generative model
Most Potent Design: For HAT1: IC50 = 72.36 ± 8.03 μM and for YTHDC1: IC50 = 32.60 ± 2.72 μM (*N* = 3 assay replicates)
Notes: There were also additional actives with a concrete measured potency > 10 µM

Title: Deep Geometry Handling and Fragment-wise Molecular 3D Graph Generation
Generative AI for designing and validating easily synthesizable and structurally novel antibiotics
Design Task: De novo design with an activity model
Outcome: µM inhibitor with in vivo validation. 6 were bioactive against A. baumannii ATCC 19606R
Notes: Enforced chemical reactions as permitted transformations during generation.

Title: Abstract 5727: ISM9682A, a novel and potent KIF18A inhibitor, shows robust antitumor effects against chromosomally unstable cancers
Notes: 110 molecules were synthesized and tested - [Source](https://www.genengnews.com/topics/artificial-intelligence/insilico-joins-scramble-to-treat-solid-tumors-by-targeting-kif18a/).

Title: A dual diffusion model enables 3D molecule generation and lead optimization based on target pockets
Notes: Original reference compound has an IC50 CDK2/E1 = 8.1 nM. 2 rounds of generation: 4 molecules synthesized from round 1 resulting in the most potent design IC50 CDK2/E1 = 0.253 nM. The second round of focused on intra-linking the molecules resulting in macrocycles. 3 were synthesized and the final most potent design IC50 CDK2/E1 = 0.090 nM.

Title: Discovery of 3-hydroxymethyl-azetidine derivatives as potent polymerase theta inhibitors
Outcome: µM inhibitor with in vivo validation
Notes: Further SAR studies ultimately led to *in vivo* validation.

Title: Quantum-assisted fragment-based automated structure generator (QFASG) for small molecule design: an in vitro study
Most Potent Design: For CAMKK2: IC50 = 3 μM and for ATM: IC50 = 4 μM

Title: Discovery of a Novel and Potent Cyclin-Dependent Kinase 8/19 (CDK8/19) Inhibitor for the Treatment of Cancer
Design Task: De novo structure-based design with some fixed moieities (based on known binder)
Most Potent Design: Compounds were manually designed based on generated molecules and 12 total compounds were synthesized. In the end, *in vitro* studies using murine CDX model for human mantle cell lymphoma showed IC50 = 1.34 nm. *In vivo* validation was achieved.

Title: Generative Active Learning For The Search of Small-molecule Protein Binders
Design Task: De novo structure-based design with some fixed moieities (based on known binder)
Most Potent Design: 35 analogues of the generated molecules were synthesized. 23/35 have IC50 < 10 μM. The most potent design has IC50 = 0.43 μM.

Title: NGT: Generative AI with Synthesizability Guarantees Identifies Potent Inhibitors for a G-protein Associated Melanocortin Receptor in a Tera-scale vHTS Screen
Design Task: De novo anagonist design using a surrogate model
Model: Combinatorial Synthesis Library Variational Auto-Encoder (CSLVAE) - first described [here](https://arxiv.org/abs/2211.04468)
Output: Query vector to decode into molecule from library
Hit Rate: Among the 13/121 with > 50% inhibition at 30 µM, 5 were selected for further assays. 1/5 had EC50 < 10 µM. Therefore 1/121 (0.83%) had affinity < 10 µM
Notes: This work is *generative* in a slightly different sense - the model decodes molecules *from* a dataset and can be seen as a combination of a generative and virtual screening method. 13/121 > 50% inhibition at 30 µM.

Title: De novo generation of multi-target compounds using deep generative chemistry
Target: Dual specificity to MEK1 and mTOR
Design Task: De novo structure-based design with some fixed moieities (based on known binder)
Notes: The 4 most potent compounds achieved > 50% reduction in phosphorlation activity of both MEK1 and mTOR at 1 μM.

Title: Synthetically Feasible De Novo Molecular Design of Leads Based on a Reinforcement Learning Model: AI-Assisted Discovery of an Anti-IBD Lead Targeting CXCR4
Outcome: nM competitive antagonism with in vivo validation
Most Potent Design: Antagonistic rate = 78.9 ± 6.2% at 10 nm (*N* = 3 assay replicates) - Table 1
Notes: Uses commercially available building blocks and molecular generation follows reaction templates. Uses AutoDock Vina as the docking protocol which is open-source. *In vivo* validation.

Title: AutoDesigner - Core Design, a De Novo Design Algorithm for Chemical Scaffolds: Application to the Design and Synthesis of Novel Selective Wee1 Inhibitors
Target: Wee1 with improved selectivity against PLK1
Outcome: µM inhibitor but with selectivity against PLK1
Most Potent Design: IC50 Wee1 = 53.8 μM and IC50 PLK1 > 10,000 μM (Table 4)
Notes: AutoDesigner is *generative* in a slightly different sense, in that it takes libraries of chemical moeities and attaches them, akin to enumeration. Uses relative free energy perturbation from Schrödinger (FEP+) combined with active learning.
